findings.title: Invoking of Unreliable Smart Contract
findings.description: The juno address may include malicious functions that can cause a multitude of unknown risks to the users, resulting in potential monetary loss for the users and reputation damage to the platform.

findings.title: Centralized Control of State Variable
findings.description: Critical state variables can be updated at any time by the controlling authorities, which can cause impacts to users and lead to significant monetary loss.

findings.title: Changing of Strategy Contract Implementation
findings.description: The tokens deposited into the contract by the users can be drained by the owner of the IzludeV2 contract, causing monetary loss for the users.

findings.title: Design Flaw in emergencyWithdraw() Function
findings.description: In the PronteraV2 contract, users cannot withdraw deposited funds when an emergency case occurs because they cannot return their kept share by themselves.

findings.title: Improper Reward Calculation in PronteraV2
findings.description: The $KSW reward miscalculation can lead to an unfair $KSW token distribution to the users, which may not comply with the tokenomics defined and announced to the users.

findings.title: Improper Reward Calculation in Emperium
findings.description: The reward of the pool that has the same staking token as the reward token will be slightly lower than what it should be, resulting in monetary loss for the users and loss of reputation for the platform.

findings.title: Transaction Ordering Dependence
findings.description: The platform's token swapping functionality is vulnerable to front-running attacks due to transaction ordering dependence, resulting in users and the platform losing a portion of tokens.

findings.title: Design Flaw in massUpdatePool() Function
findings.description: The massUpdatePools() function will eventually be unusable due to excessive gas usage because it calls updatePool() for all added farms and cannot remove them, only disable by setting pool.allocPoint to 0.

findings.title: Liquidity Token Amount Miscalculation
findings.description: A small amount of token can be left in the contract, resulting in a lower amount of tokens used in the compounding.

findings.title: Insufficient Logging for Privileged Function
findings.description: Privileged function that is executable by the controlling parties is not logged properly by emitting events.

findings.title: Improper Function Visibility
findings.description: The set() function's visibility should be changed to external if it is not called from any internal function.

findings.title: Inexplicit Solidity Compiler Version
findings.description: The Solidity compiler versions declared in the smart contracts were not explicit, which may potentially result in compatibility issues.
